title: People will learn SAD’s value after they suffer from drought for 5 years: Sukhbir Singh Badal
text:
People will learn SAD’s value after they suffer from drought for 5 years: Sukhbir Singh Badal People will learn SAD’s value after they suffer from drought for 5 years: Sukhbir Singh Badal Former Deputy Chief Minister of Punjab and Shiromani Akali President, Sukhbir Singh Badal expressed his anguish and disappointment at the voters comparing them to someone who eats too much and then threw up. By: FE Online | Published: March 17, 2017 11:04 AM In what seemed like a rant, Sukhbir Singh Badal added that people did not understand the difference between good and bad until they acknowledge things. (PTI) 
Former Deputy Chief Minister of Punjab and Shiromani Akali President, Sukhbir Singh Badal expressed his anguish and disappointment at the voters comparing them to someone who eats too much and then threw up. Speaking to IE, on the day that Congress ’ Captain Amarinder Singh took the oath, Badal said that if a man eats too much, he vomited. Speaking in Punjabi, he added “Apan jyada khawa ta lokaan nu”, which translates to ‘We gave people too much to eat’. He was speaking at a gathering of his party workers, saying that the government gave liberal grants, grids and water channels to the people of Punjab. 
Badal’a party, SAD, along with its long-time alliance, BJP lost the elections miserably coming third in the race with even fewer seats than the Aam Aadmi Party . He added that the people would learn the value of the SAD-BJP government when they suffer a drought for 5 years. In what seemed like a rant, Sukhbir Singh Badal added that people did not understand the difference between good and bad until they acknowledge things. People did not acknowledge the good works of his party, Badal seemed to complain. Sukhbir Singh Badal was accompanied by SAD leader Mantar Singh Brar, who said that the people must ask the Indian National Congress to deliver on their promises of loan waiving and job opportunity for every family.

Earlier yesterday, Captain Amarinder Singh of the Congress, took oath as the new Chief Minister of Punjab. The ceremony which took place at the Punjab Raj Bhawan was administrated by the governor of the state, P Singh Badnore. Meanwhile, the party put rest to the speculations that had suggested that Navjot Singh Sidhu would be awarded the post of the Deputy CM.
